Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Dendritic Cell and Poxvector Vaccines in Colorectal Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 74 patients disease-free after CRC metastasectomy and perioperative chemotherapy were randomised

Participants.evidence: patients disease-free after CRC metastasectomy and perioperative chemotherapy

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either autologous DCs modified with PANVAC (DC/PANVAC) or PANVAC with granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates whether vaccines based on dendritic cells (DCs) and poxvectors encoding carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) and MUC1 (PANVAC) improve survival in patients with resected CRC metastases.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was recurrence-free survival at 2 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 74 patients disease-free after CRC metastasectomy and perioperative chemotherapy were randomised

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 2 years, recurrence-free survival was 47% for DC/PANVAC and 55% for PANVAC/GM-CSF (χ2 P = 0.48).
